DOC.brief_summary: Tiny molecules (hormones) are released from the bowels and other organs to the bloodstream in response to meals in order to orchestrate the metabolism. Oxyntomodulin, GLP-1 and glucagon are all known to regulate parameters such as appetite, food intake and induce weight loss. Therefore we want to investigate mechanistic relations between the three hormones.
DOC.brief_title: Oxyntomodulin, Mechanisms of Action in Relation to Appetite, Food Intake, Gastric Emptying and Energy Expenditure.
